page.title: 01SCOTTON & NORTHORPE SUMMARY
page.content: This is a rural area, lying roughly midway between the market town of Gainsborough (10km SW of Northorpe) and the steel town of Scunthorpe (12km N of Scotton). Northorpe (135 inhabitants) and Scotton (450) are far from being domitory villages. The land is devoted almost entirely to farming, but very few people living here are involved in agriculture; many work outside the area. Travel is mainly by private car; little public transport remains, but Scotton is on a bus route. The railway running SW-NE across the eastern half of the area is now reduced to single track and carries goods only. {Scotton, Land- {scape and Buildings, Population, {and Local History (except place names) {are entered under Block 04880399, as {most of Scotton lies in that area. Author: Scotton & District WI
